cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to slow, then turn west-northwest and approach the central Texas coast, eventually bending north toward the TX-LA border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Texas coast between Port Aransas and High Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island and eastward into southwest Louisiana, including Port Arthur area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible; low (5%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in the Sabine Lake/Port Arthur area during onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 in with locally higher totals, producing freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible inland flooding could restrict port and landside operations.
